creator: shao@infraworks.com
text:
the body data after the blank line in the request could not pass through the 
mod_jk, tomcat server throws EOFexceptions when a servlet trys to read data 
from request stream because it could not receive the data stream.
2002-06-17 17:52:17 StandardWrapperValve
[org.apache.catalina.INVOKER.FileExchangeServer]: Servlet.service() for servlet 
org.apache.catalina.INVOKER.FileExchangeServer threw exception
java.io.EOFException
        at java.io.DataInputStream.readInt(DataInputStream.java:343)
 

tomcat4 stand alone server works fine with the http tunnel
both tomcat3 and tomcat3 with mod_jk(for 3) work fine

creator: shao@infraworks.com

text: the attachment (id=2110) was a zip file, includes a simple netscape 4 plug-in
creator: shao@infraworks.com
cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Can you reproduce this without using a plugin ( ie. a small java client
or use ant tasks to upload/send data ) ??

Most likely it's an issue with the body ( does it have Content-Length ?). You 
can enable debugging in several places in jk - to see what is sent. ( or use
etherreal ! )

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
This bug report has been transferred to Tomcat 5 because TC4 and TC5 share the 
connectors and TC5 is now the focus of development effort

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
The original connector was wrong. This is actually referring to the JK 
connector which is deprecated.

Please use the JK2 connector.

(In reply to comment #7)
> The original connector was wrong. This is actually referring to the JK 
> connector which is deprecated.
> Please use the JK2 connector.

Did you mean JK2 is deprecated?  On tomcat site it says JK2 is no longer 
supported.  I still have the same problem with mod_jk 1.2.6.  Please let me 
know if there is a way to fix it.

Thanks,
Michael
creator: mlu@7thonline.com

text:
At the time of my comment JK was deprecated and dev efforts were focussed on
JK2. After some further JK2 development and for various reasons I won't repeat
here the consenus was that actually a move back to JK was the better way forward.

Reviewing the previous comments, you need to respond to Costin's points in
comment 5 or this issue will be closed as invalid.
creator: markt@apache.org
yoavs@computer.org
text:
2+ months gone with no further comment, and specifically no experimentation with
the multiple mod_jk updates that have been released since the original filing,
nor a response to Mark's last post.
